action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the table, the book on the table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a pantry now. There are a refrigerator and a freezer. The refrigerator is closed. The freezer is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a apple, a sandwich, a peach, a orange and a banana.
The freezer is now open. The freezer is empty.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard, a plate and a counter. The cupboard is closed. The plate is on the counter. There are passages to a pantry and a living room here.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate.
You can't see a table here.
You are in a living room now. There are a table, a book, a shelf, a chair, a side table and a couch. The book is on the side table. There are passages to a hallway and a kitchen here.
You put the plate on the table.
You take the book. In your inventory you have a book.
You put the book on the table.

> go to pantry


> take pillow


> go to living room

> put pillow on table


> done
You can't go to a pantry from here.

> put book on table
